welcome_post_body:
To get started you can [read the documentation](https://join-lemmy.org/docs/index.html).

Your instance is already federated with the Lemmyverse. Go to the "All" tab on the frontpage to see content from other instances. This content is incomplete, follow a community to receive all new posts, comments and votes. For more details see [Getting started with Federation](https://join-lemmy.org/docs/administration/federation_getting_started.html).

If you have any problems with Lemmy, check out the [Troubleshooting guide](https://join-lemmy.org/docs/administration/troubleshooting.html). You can also ask questions in !lemmy@lemmy.ml or the [admin chat on Matrix](https://matrix.to/#/#lemmy-support-general:discuss.online).

To get notified about new Lemmy versions, please subscribe to one of the following channels:
- !announcements@lemmy.ml
- [join-lemmy.org](https://join-lemmy.org/news)
- [github.com](https://github.com/LemmyNet/lemmy/releases)

You can delete or unfeature this post with the context menu above.
cross_posts: This link has also been posted to:
too_many_images_upload: Exceeded maximum of {{formattedCount}} image to upload. Please select only one image.
too_many_images_upload_plural: Exceeded maximum of {{formattedCount}} images to upload. Please select fewer images.
cannot_leave_admin: You cannot leave the server without an admin
left_admin_team: You have left the admin team
left_mod_team: You have left the mod team
profile_not_logged_in_alert: You are not logged in. If you use a Fediverse account that is able to follow users, you can follow this user.
community_not_logged_in_alert: You are not logged in. However you can subscribe from another Fediverse account, for example Lemmy or Mastodon. To do this, paste the following into the search field of your instance: <1>!{{community}}@{{instance}}</1>
remove_as_mod_are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to remove {{user}} as a moderator for {{community}}?
appoint_as_mod_are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to appoint {{user}} as a moderator for {{community}}?
remove_as_admin_are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to remove {{user}} from the {{instance}} admin team?
appoint_as_admin_are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to appoint {{user}} as an admin of {{instance}}?
only_mods_can_post_in_community: Only moderators can post to this community
locked_post_comment_placeholder: This content is locked, you can not comment.
delete_account_content: Delete all posts, comments and uploaded images
delete_account_confirm: Warning: this will permanently delete your account. The deletion may not always federate to other instances. Enter your password to confirm.
purge_warning: Warning: Purging will delete this item, and all its children from the database. You will not be able to recover the data. Use with extreme caution.
modlog_content_warning: <1>CONTENT WARNING</1>: Some deleted posts may contain disturbing or adult material. Proceed with caution.
purge_success: The item has been successfully purged.
creator: Creator
name: Name
name_explain: Name ‚Äì used as the identifier for the community, cannot be changed.
display_name_explain: Display name ‚Äî shown as the title on the community's page, can be changed.

active_users_in_the_last_day_plural: {{formattedCount}} active users in the last day

all_description: Shows all communities, including federated ones
moderator_view_description: Only show contributions from communtities you are a moderator of
read_terms_and_conditions: I agree to the terms and conditions.
notifications_error: Desktop notifications not available in your browser. Try Firefox or Chrome.
error_page_paragraph: There was an error on the server. Try refreshing your browser. If that doesn't work, come back at a later time. If the problem persists, you can seek help in the <1>Lemmy support community</1> or <2>Lemmy Matrix room</2>.
error_page_admin_matrix: If you would like to reach out to one of {{instance}} admins for support, try the following Matrix addresses:
error_code_message: The server returned this error: <1>{{error}}</1>. This may be useful for admins and developers to diagnose and fix the error
not_found_page_message: The page you are looking for does not exist.
not_found_return_home_button: Click here to return to your homepage
invalid_password: Password length must be between 10 and 60 characters.
reset_password_mail_sent: Sent an Email to reset your password.
no_email_setup: This server hasn't correctly set up email.
private_message_disclaimer: Warning: Private messages in Lemmy are not secure. Please create an account on <1>Matrix</1> for secure messaging.
undetermined_language_warning: Warning: If you deselect Undetermined, you will not see most content.
transfer_community_are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to transfer {{community}} to {{user}}?
must_login: You must <1>log in</1> or <2>register</2> to comment.
community_ban: You have been banned from this community.
site_ban: You have been banned from the site
parent_comment_not_in_post: The parent comment belongs to another post.
couldnt_find_that_username_or_email: Couldn't find that username or email.
no_password_reset: You will not be able to reset your password without an email.
system_err_login: System error. Try logging out and back in.
rate_limit_error: Too many requests, try again later.
no_private_message_edit_allowed: Not allowed to edit private message.
block_leaving: Are you sure you want to leave?
blocked_all_communities_from_these_insta: Blocked all communities from these instances
blocked_all_users_from_these_instances: Blocked all users from these instances
keyword_blocks_placeholder: Enter any keywords you'd like to block from your feed, one block per line.
fill_out_application: To join this server, you need to fill out this application, and wait to be accepted.
application_email_admins: Email admins on receiving new applications
reports_email_admins: Email admins on receiving new reports
permissive_regex: Regular expression would match any provided text.
rate_limit_info: Lemmy can limit requests per IP address for various actions. The Rate Limit field is how many times that IP address can perform that action, and Per Second is the number of seconds before the rate limit resets.
custom_emoji_save_validation: All fields must be filled in and shortcode can't be duplicated.
invalid_totp_code: Invalid 2FA code: Must be string of six digits
totp_qr_segue: or scan this QR code in an authenticator app
cant_enable_private_instance_and_federat: Can't enable private instance and federation together
open_links_in_new_tab: Open links in a new tab
remote_follow_prompt: Enter the instance you would like to follow this community from
remote_follow_local_instance: Cannot fetch local instance for remote follow
import_export_section_description: Import and export your account settings as JSON
import_export_rate_limit_error: Please wait a few minutes before trying to import or export settings again
delete_oauth_provider_are_you_sure: Are you sure you want to delete this provider?
community_locked_message: <1>Community locked:</1> only moderators can create posts. You can still comment on posts.
community_visibility_public_desc: This community is visible to everyone.
community_visibility_unlisted_desc: This community is visible to everyone, but not shown in global/all feeds.
community_visibility_local_only_public_d: This community does not federate and is only available to local users (including those who are not logged in).
community_visibility_local_only_private_: This community does not federate and is only available to local users who are logged in.
community_visibility_private_desc: This community is private and can only by viewed by users who were manually approved by the moderators.
public_blurb: This community can be federated to other instances and be posted/commented in by their users.
private_blurb: Only approved users can interact with this community.
banned_from_community_blurb: <1>Banned:</1> You cannot post, comment, or vote in this community. However, you are still free to browse.
private_message_form_user_matrix_blurb: This user already has a matrix account you can message at <1>{{matrix_id}}</1>.
block_urls_placeholder: Put your blocked URLs here, one URL per line. Regex strings work also, IE *.example.com
content_warning_setting_blurb: Setting a content warning will display a prompt with the content warning asking the user for their consent to continue.
leave_admin_team_confirmation: Are you sure you want to leave the admin team?
leave_mod_team_confirmation: Are you sure you want to leave the mod team?
torrent_help: Lemmy can use a technology called BitTorrent to view or stream media. <1>Click here</1> to learn how.
donation_dialog_message:
An open source project the size of Lemmy needs constant work to manage the project, implement new features and fix bugs. Dessalines and Nutomic work full-time on these tasks and more. As there is no advertising or tracking, all of our work is funded through donations. Even so there is barely enough time in the day, and no time for a second job. The only available option are user donations. To keep it viable donations need to reach a minimum of 5000‚Ç¨ per month, resulting in a modest salary of 2500‚Ç¨ per developer. If that goal is reached we can stop worrying about money, and fully focus on improving the software for the benefit of all users and instances. We especially rely on recurring donations to secure the long-term development and make Lemmy the best it can be.

If you want more information before donating, consider the comparison with Reddit. It began as startup funded by rich investors. The site is managed by corporate executives who over time have become more and more disconnected from normal users. Their main goal is to make investors happy and to make a profit. This leads to user-hostile decisions like firing the employee responsible for AMAs, blocking third-party apps and more. As Reddit is a single website under a single authority, it means all users need to follow the same rules, including ridiculous ones like censoring the name "Luigi".

Lemmy represents a new type of social media which is the complete opposite of Reddit. It is split across many different websites, each with its own rules, and managed by normal people who actually care about the users. There is no company and no profit motive. Much of the work is carried out by volunteer admins, mods and posters, who contribute out of enthusiasm and not for money. For users this is great as there is no advertising nor tracking, and no chance of takeover by a billionaire. Additionally there are no builtin political or ideological restrictions. You can use the software for any purpose you like, add your own restrictions or scrutinize its inner workings. Lemmy truly belongs to everyone.

Nutomic and Dessalines, Lemmy Developers
auto_mark_fetched_posts_as_read: Automatically mark fetched post as read
upload_and_publish_image_desc: The uploaded image will be distributed to federated instances without any further user interactions.
new_account_label: New account, created within the last 7 days
banned_dialog_body: You cannot post, vote or take other actions. However you can continue to browse the site, and on the settings page export your settings to import on another Lemmy instance, create a backup or delete your account.
cant_view_private_community_message: You don't have permission to view this community. Click the follow button and wait for manual approval by a moderator to see the content.
not_top_mod: You are not the top mod
not_higher_mod: Cannot make changes to higher ranked moderator
not_higher_admin: Cannot make changes to higher ranked admin
honeypot_failed: Honeypot check failed, are you a bot?
registration_application_is_pending: Registration is awaiting review by an admin
nsfw_not_allowed: NSFW content is not allowed on this instance
edit_private_message_not_allowed: You are not allowed to edit this private message
application_question_required: You must answer the application question
invalid_default_post_listing_type: Cannot use Subscribed or ModeratorView as default post listing
person_is_banned_from_community: You are banned from this community
no_id_given: Either name or id must be provided
invalid_body_field: Text is too long or too short
totp_already_enabled: TOTP is already enabled for your account
blocked_url: URL is blocked on this instance
slurs: Text contains a slur which is blocked by this instance
invalid_url_scheme: Invalid URL scheme, only http, https and magnet are allowed
contradicting_filters: Cant use filters 'liked only' and 'disliked only' together
ban_expiration_in_past: Ban expiration time is in the past
invalid_bot_action: Bots are not allowed to vote
tag_not_in_community: The tag not allowed in this community
post_schedule_time_must_be_in_future: Post schedule time must be in the future
too_many_scheduled_posts: You cant have more than 10 active scheduled posts at once
email_notifications_disabled: Email notifications are disabled on this instance
multi_community_update_wrong_user: You are not allowed to update this multi-community
multi_community_entry_limit_reached: Maximum number of entries reached for multi-community
community_not_federated_message: Only local users are currently following this community. To get more followers, promote it across the Lemmyverse and share the identifier <1>communityName</1>. You can also use <2>lemmy-federate.com</2>.
dead_community_body: This community has not federated for more than a week. New posts and comments will probably be missing. It is likely that the instance is down or defederated.
